Whenever you reach 3 or more you get the full status (red apple). Satisfaction decrease by 1 at each cycle.

Meadow

So we had an argument ongoing at the ship, where a player states that "you can take off with the Icarus if there is a pilot present just by clicking 'take off Icarus' however the player that is not a pilot who attempts to do it is blocked by NERON.

Bug or no bug?
On september 17, 2013
spacekadt

Meadow - it depends on the neron bios settings. It can be set so that only pilots can actually take off, in which case only a pilot will be able to take off in the Icarus. If piloting is unlocked, someone who doesn't have the pilot skill could take off in the Icarus.

As for whether the landing will automatically go well just because a pilot is on board - I don't know.
On september 17, 2013
Meadow

I see, it is just as I thought then. Thanks Spacekadt.
On september 17, 2013
spacekadt

If you need it changed, Janice can change it to one of three options:

Piloting - only pilots can launch anything
Projects - only someone with the designer skill can access NERON projects
Research - only someone with doctor or biologist skills can do lab research

Unfortunately, there's no "none" option, so something always needs to be locked.

On october 24, 2013
spacekadt
tfenixfavorite thread is a bit screwed up.. for some reason threads just appear on it even though i did not favorite it.. this causes me to have to un-favorite them.. also, whenever 1 thread was un-favorited, it bounces back to the main thread... alot of times i did not notice and thought i was still on the favorite thread and i continue to "un-favorite" the threads, not knowing i am just putting them back to favorite thread again... anyone have the same issue and gripe?

I got this!

There's a "bug" in the chat system that happens more often with more new threads.

This bug will hide new responses from you until you scroll all the way to the bottom of the chat then hit the Daedalus link at the top of the page (or refresh). At first, it's not that bad, but in later days you'll need to make sure that you scroll all the way down to the point where the very first message about gravity appears. Sometimes, you'll get a "warning" that this is the case if your "favorites" tab goes all funky and suddenly has threads you didn't favorite.

On november 22, 2013
Zelgadis

Encountered a strange and balance-breaking bug. Played as Raluca for the first time, went to sleep (in-game, of course), then remembered that I left Srodinger in the neighboring room and pressed on the door. She stood up (withought waking up, apparently), and I exited the room as usual. Fun thing: the "sleeping" status was still there, so, technically, I were sleepwalking and regaining my AP at a higher rate with no need for sleep (note: I *did* refresh the page afterwards, but sleep status was still intact). I managed to get rid of it by going to bed again and waking up normally (button command).
It's a nice cheat to have, but I'd rather reveal it before I get banned or something.^^
On november 22, 2013
[6826491]

That's not a bug, per se, and there is no exploit involved. If you click on the floor while in bed, you might move around the room, but the "Get Up" button should still be on the left side. You can even check the contents of the shelf while in bed (but I reason that to be the same as looking from a distance). As long as you don't click on a person, interact with an item, or some other action that makes you get out of bed...then you don't actually leave the bed. As you noted, you could refresh and still see yourself in bed. An action that made you leave it would be reflected in the room logs, too.
If you did leave the bed, it would be impossible to conduct DIY Surgery in the Medlab.

On november 22, 2013
Zelgadis

I see. Thank you, that was helpful!

It's not really a bug, and actually it is not that important to see all the hunters. You only need to look at the first 5 hunters on the right. On december 16, 2013
[6826491]
ishimuchrome. (maybe other browser too?) occasionally the time stamp will be covered by the text in the text box in the chat screen. looks like it happens when the sentence isn't long enough to wrap to the next line

That happens in Firefox as well. It usually gets slightly more legible later on, but I know that's not much consolation.
ctrl enter doesn't always start a new line. not sure why. i mean.. it starts a new line when you type it.. but when displayed, it doesn't always start a new line.
When you want to add a line break, hit ctrl+enter, then hit the space bar once before hitting ctrl+enter again. You'll see the text on a new line once you resume typing.

If you want to insert a line break earlier in your post, you'll have to cut the text from after the point you want the line break to be, add in the line break, then paste the text you just cut. It's the only way I've found to make the line break fit to the formatting. The system always adds the new line at the bottom of whatever was already typed, so this little workaround circumvents that for longer posts.

Boost Morale

If you find yourself in a room (the Dormitory, for example) where some of your crewmates are sleeping, your presence will cause their Movement Point (pm) gain to be replaced by a Morale Point (moral) gain.

Your crewmate's morale will increase automatically. If they are afflicted by a psychological illness, this will heal progressively.

Everyone needs some therapy sometimes, even if they're not ill.

PA is in fact the french abbreviation for the Action Points (“points de action” or something like that)…

You still can move even when you are out of MP by (automatically) converting AP to MP, so in fact your movement is only limited by the amount of AP.

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

No, there is no warning. Once my ship lost about 4 cycles of oxygen before realizing a tank was broken because of an electrical spike.

When there is a fire, you should always check everything in the room. And you should always check the alerts and keep track of broken things, in case an electrical spike damages equipment without Neron saying anything (that's why it is important to report things when you don't repair them, because it enables you to know if there are new ones). Of course it is also necessary when the mush are alive, in case they sabotage things.

I reported it earlier. I think it's caused by excessively long threads. If you have, say... a thread with 200 replies, the game seems to load every single one of those replies. That's like 6 people loading up 1600 posts every single time they refresh the screen - which is a hell lot when people are communicating where fires and broken crap is every 5 minutes. It might not even be MT's fault, could be one of the scripts.

May not be how the system works, but that seems to be it from my observation. It sucked a hell lot of my bandwidth too.

Our solution was to purge all of those ultra long thread and close and reopen long chats. It did a good job of ending the lag.

On january 25, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

The problem with excessive lag was reported, and they are indeed caused by long threads. It also seems to get worse if people scroll down the discussion channel to read older messages.

The devs are trying to find solutions, and things are a little better now than they used to be a few weeks ago (except that now there's the problem of messages appearing several times or disappearing). But they're trying to fix all this.


AndreI have burnt hand and burnt arms but when i look at an door it says repairing costs 1AP still also i find it weird that it says it costs 3AP to examine the door

Several wounds cause actions to cost 1, 2 or 3 AP more than they usually do, even free actions like getting up, lying down, examining, consuming... The exception is actions that can be performed using special action points, even if you don't have the required skill. For example, repairing costs 1 for technicians, so it costs 1 AP if you have a wound.

It is probably a bug (though a convenient one), and was also already reported.

Patches1984

Or maybe it's some kind of feature making Schrödinger appear like he is and isn't in there at the same time

Schrodinger only registers as being in a room if someone's not carrying him. If someone moved him without dropping him, the game will treat him as being in the previous room.
Now that raises the question if Schrodinger can die by a fire while he's in someone's inventory several rooms away...
